content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Search for papers on 'neural networks for image processing' in the Computer Science category on ArXiv and report how many were submitted in the last week.  Please interact with https://arxiv.org/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We need advanced search page to enter terms, category Computer Science, and date range (last week). Use link.
Action: Click [157]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to select Computer Science category.
Action: Click [2147]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We need a way to constrain the date to the past week; the Simple Search page has built‑in “past week” date filters that will be easier than manually computing dates.  
Action: Click [2404]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We need date filter; better to use advanced search again.
Action: Click [3518]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter search keywords into the “Search term” textbox.  
Action: Type [4129]; neural networks for image processing
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Limit to Computer Science category by checking its checkbox.  
Action: Click [4131]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to return to the advanced search form to add the Computer Science category filter; use the “Refine query” link.
Action: Click [5647]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use the Simple Search page (it provides a ready “past week” filter) rather than building a manual date range.  
Action: Click [9835]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We need to input the query text in the search box on the Simple Search page.
Action: Type [10826]; neural networks for image processing
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the Advanced Search page (pre‑filled with the current query) where we can set the Computer Science category and the date range.
Action: Click [11892]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Select the Computer Science category checkbox.
Action: Click [18169]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to enable Date range option to input last week’s dates.
Action: Click [18184]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enable the “Date range” option to allow entering specific dates for the last week.  
Action: Click [18184]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Run the search now (query entered, Computer Science category selected); we can apply the “past week” filter on the results page.  
Action: Click [18885]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Let’s open Google so we can quickly reach the “https://arxiv.org/list/cs/pastweek” listing, which contains every Computer‑Science submission from the last 7 days; then we can filter that page for our keywords.  
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform a Google query to reach the arXiv Computer‑Science “past week” list filtered by the required keywords.  
Action: Type [1]; site:arxiv.org/list/cs/pastweek neural networks image processing
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current page is Google’s “Sorry / CAPTCHA” page; the previous page in history should be the arXiv advanced‑search form we were using. We need to return there and finish setting the date range.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform a Google search for “arxiv advanced search” to reach arXiv’s search interface.  
Action: Type [1]; arxiv advanced search
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google is blocked by CAPTCHA. I’ll navigate directly to arXiv’s search page instead of using Google.
Action: Type [1]; https://arxiv.org/search?query=neural+networks+image+processing&searchtype=all&source=header

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to previous page to exit the Google CAPTCHA and get back to earlier pages (ideally the arXiv advanced‑search form).  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Navigate directly to arXiv’s advanced‑search page by entering its URL.
Action: Type [1]; https://arxiv.org/search/advanced
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google is blocked; need to go back through history until the previous arXiv page we were on re‑appears.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Continue stepping back in browser history until we leave Google and return to the arXiv page we were working on.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Select “Date range” option so we can enter from 2025‑04‑23 to 2025‑04‑30 for the last week.  
Action: Click [18184]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Go to the arXiv home page, where we can navigate to Computer Science → “past week” listing that already shows all CS submissions from the last 7 days.  
Action: Click [18295]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the Computer Science recent submissions list to then change URL to “pastweek”.
Action: Click [20212]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Navigate to the Computer Science “new” list; from there we can access the “past week” list.
Action: Click [20209]
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: Need to open the “recent CoRR” (Computer Science) list which is link [20212].  
Action: Click [20212]
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: We should access the Computer Science “past week” submissions list directly via URL; that will show every CS paper from the last 7 days and we can then filter for our keywords.
Action: Type [1]; https://arxiv.org/list/cs/pastweek?show=1000
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: The categories list on the arXiv home page may not yet be in view; let’s scroll the main window downward to reveal and interact with the “Computer Science (cs)” link.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
